thread.title: Mel Gibson in Talks to Direct ‘Suicide Squad’ Sequel
thread.title_full: Mel Gibson in Talks to Direct ‘Suicide Squad’ Sequel

author: Daniel Pearson
title: Mel Gibson in Talks to Direct ‘Suicide Squad’ Sequel
text:
Mel Gibson is in talks with Warner Bros. to direct Suicide Squad 2 , according to The Hollywood Reporter. 
Sources say the two sides are in early talks, and that no official offer or commitment has yet been made. The studio is also discussing other possible candidates, including Swedish director Daniel Espinosa.
David Ayer directed the first movie, which featured an all-star cast of Will Smith, Margot Robbie, Jared Leto and more. The film premiered to less-than-favorable reviews , but still managed to gross $745 million worldwide — enough to get executives focused on fast-tracking a sequel.

That Gibson is even being considered for the job marks a bit of a turnaround for the actor-director’s career. He’s back in the spotlight thanks to his Oscar-nominated movie, Hacksaw Ridge, following years of obscurity after a drunk driving arrest and his anti-Semitic comments in the early 2000s.
The Reporter also states he is in talks to join Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg for Paramount’s Daddy’s Home 2 and indie crime movie Dragged Across Concrete . Stay tuned for more information.
In other news, Pusha T confirms Kanye West is working on an album .
